alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 02 at 12:19PM CDT until July 02 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR EAST CENTRAL COOK COUNTY... At 1219 PM CDT, widespread roadway flooding, underpass flooding, disruptions to public transportation, and basement flooding were ongoing due to heavy rainfall in central Cook County. Rainfall of 1 to 3 inches has been widespread since earlier this morning, with highest amounts near 6 inches observed in isolated areas near Cicero and Berwyn. Rainfall rates have diminished to about 1 inch per hour or less across the area. Although new flash flooding is becoming less likely, standing water will be slow to recede while rainfall continues. HAZARD...Significant flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Rapid-onset, significant flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, low-lying areas, and poor drainage areas. Widespread street and underpass flooding. Possible flooding of structures. Possible flooding of highways. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chicago, Cicero, Hammond, Oak Lawn, Berwyn, Oak Park, Lemont, Midway Airport, Austin, West Town, Irving Park, Palos Park, Blue Island, La Grange. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service or your local law enforcement agency only when you can do so safely.
